title: Nobody will take the Conservatives’ general election promises seriously if Javid lets borrowing run riot
text:
Not many jobs come with the luxury of setting your own targets.

Normally a boss will have something to say if you try to decide to set the criteria for your own annual appraisal.

But the Chancellor does not have a normal job, and he is free to set his own fiscal targets for annual borrowing and debt levels.

So why has Sajid Javid not taken advantage of this golden opportunity?

New rules were expected alongside the Budget in November, but he cancelled that last week.

The issue is pressing.

Philip Hammond’s old rules are out of date.

The deficit is rising sharply, so the longer the Chancellor takes to set out a new ‘fiscal framework’, the longer it will be before he can give himself top marks...
